Only 15% of Bay Area cities have met housing plan deadline. What are the consequences?

More than two months after their deadline, most Bay Area cities haven’t submitted plans to build required housing that satisfy the state. That means developers could try to bypass local restrictions — but likely not without encountering a lawsuit.
